Standards: NIST SP 800-61 Rev 3 (integrates IR into CSF 2.0 risk management, emphasizes lessons learned); NIST CSF 2.0 (Govern function for continuous improvement via documentation). Sources: NIST SP 800-61r3 (https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-61r3.pdf), NIST CSF 2.0 (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework/framework). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list from JSON above] - Active Learning: Tie flashcards to activities (e.g., scenario questions from problem-solving exercise). - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across 4 layers [insert summaries from JSON above]; tag each card with layer. - Prior Knowledge: Assume familiarity with full IR Lifecycle. Generate flashcards per schema: 25 cards in JSON array format. Ensure university-level rigor (Bloom's spanning all levels), active recall, spaced repetition friendly. Distractors per protocol.
